title: Test Statistic for a Chi-Square GOF Test
question_text:
The Advanced Placement (AP) Statistics examination was first administered in May $1997$. Students’ papers are graded on a scale of $1$ – $5$, with $5$ being the highest score. Over $10{,}000$ students took the exam in the first year, and the distribution of all scores was as follows:
A distance learning class of $75$ students that took AP Statistics via an online platform had the following distribution of grades:
Which of the following is the correct value of the chi-square test statistic for a Goodness of Fit Test?
tables:
Score$1$$2$$3$$4$$5$
Percent$19.1$%$25.8$%$20.8$%$23$%$11.3$%

Score$1$$2$$3$$4$$5$
Frequency$11$$23$$21$$11$$9$
solution:
Solution

When a one-way table is give in a chi-square setting, it usually contains the observed values from the study. In order to calculate the expected value of any cell from the two-way table, use the formula

$\text{expected value} = \dfrac{(\text {row total})(\text {column total})}{\text {table total}}$

For this setting, the expected values are given in the table below:

The formula for calculating the chi-square test statistic, $\chi^2$, is given on the official Statistics A.P. Formula Sheet.

$\chi^2$ = $\Sigma$ $\dfrac{(\text {observed value - expected value})^2}{\text {expected value}}$

Here, the chi-square test statistic, $\chi^2$ = $\Sigma$ $\dfrac{(\text {observed value - expected value})^2}{\text {expected value}}$ = $\dfrac{(11 - 14.325)^2}{14.325}$ + $\dfrac{(23 - 19.35)^2}{19.35}$ + $\dfrac{(21 - 15.6)^2}{15.6}$ + $\dfrac{(11 - 17.25)^2}{17.25}$ + $\dfrac{(9 - 8.475)^2}{8.475}$ = $5.63$

Choice 'A' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice ‘B’ is incorrect: $6.56$ is the value calculated if each fraction had the observed value in the denominator, rather than the expected value.

Choice ‘C’ is incorrect: $0.229$ is the correct value for the P-value for the test.

Choice ‘D’ is incorrect: $4$ is the correct value for the degrees of freedom for this setting.

Choice ‘E’ is incorrect: $0.0023$ is the value calculated without squaring the numerator of each fraction that contributes to the total sum.
